_header: Will ye not I-hear this English tale that is here I-write
Subjects: Thomas of Canterbury, saint, life of; saints’ lives
_description: The Life of St. Thomas of Canterbury, beginning with the story of Gilbert, father of St. Thomas, in the South English Legendary

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
WOlle ȝe nou vndurstonde hou hit is i writeOf seint Thomas of
                    Canterburi hou he was bi ȝite…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…þerto þei hedde wel luytel help and were ful sore
                    agasteAc vr lord for seint Thomas loue his grace sone on hem
                    caste…
BodEngPoeta1.Note: Imperfect at end due to loss of folios 81-88.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
Wolle ȝe nouþe i heore þis englische tale þat is
                    here i write Of Seint Thomas of Caunterburi al hou he was bi
                    ȝite…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Þei beon swyþe repentaunt ase þis kniȝtes
                    weren ich weneȝuyt ne libbeth heo nouȝt half heore lif ant
                    þat was bi heom isene
BodLauMis108.Note:
Continues with 4768 as
                    if part of this text.
BodLauMis108.Attributed Title:
Ici poez oyer coment Seint Thomas de kaunterbures nasqui e de queo manere
                    gent de pere e de mere (f. 61)

BLSto949.First Lines: Engelond glad glad þou be for þou mayht wel eþe& þou al so al holi churche for one monnes deþe…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …ffor þe sauter seiþ þat suche men þat of trecherie beþNe scholle naut half hor dayes lybbe as we alle yseþ

Lam223.First Lines:
Wole ȝe now here now hit is y writeOf saynt Thomas of
                    Canterburye how he was y gete…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for þat love þat saynt Thomas on
                    þoȝtȜeve vs part of þat ioye þat he so dere
                    boȝt Amen
Lam223.Note:
Some defacing of the text has been carried out by an antipapist whose
                    focus seems to have been St. Thomas.
